name.en: Interpretation of Classics of Western Philosophy

goal.ch:
一，增進歐陸當代哲學思想之認識。
二，透過原典閱讀，增進文本分析能力。
三，透過課堂討論，鍛鍊獨立思想與論述之能力。
goal.en:
1. Enhance understanding of contemporary European philosophical thought.
2. Improve text analysis skills by reading the original text.
3. Through classroom discussions, students can develop their independent thinking and discussion abilities.

outline.ch:
16世紀的思想家蒙田（Michel de Montaigne）被稱為「思想的寶庫」。他出身為貴族，閱歷廣博，思想開闊。他身處的文藝復興時期，一方面，正在脫離了混亂、征戰、野蠻與壓抑的黑暗中世紀，另一方面，正要創建一個新的時代。這種分裂的轉向使此時期的精神充滿解放的自由性，敢冒險，勇於嘗試。從Bosch，Botticelli到Da Vinci，可以見到藝術創新的風格迥異，充滿斷裂的繼承。在人文思想方面，蒙田的《隨筆集》(Les Essais)也彰顯了此時的人們好奇於一切，急欲對任何事物發表看法，充滿各種觀察與洞見，這也奠定了「隨筆」（essai）的核心意涵：思想的創新嘗試。
《隨筆集》共有107篇短文，內容涉及日常生活、習俗分析與生命反思，分成三卷出版。本學期著重於「第一卷」內容的討論。課程分為兩個階段進行，第一階段，通過文本閱讀，理解蒙田的思想。第二階段，探究蒙田的思想與當代社會現象之關係，與形塑個人人格的借鏡。
01週：課程介紹。
02週：論憂傷或佯裝。
03週：論激情。
04週：論無聊或放空。
05週：論說謊或創造。
06週：論預言或預期。
07週：論待客之道。
08週：論友誼。
09週：論判斷力或偏見。
10週：論想像力或幻覺。
11週：論習慣或機械性。
12週：論差異或歧視。
13週：論無用或大用。
14週：論奢侈的生產或節儉的永續。
15週：論死亡與哲學。
16週：論年紀。
17週：期末論文寫作I。
18週：期末論文寫作II。
outline.en:
The 16th-century thinker Michel de Montaigne has been called “a treasure trove of ideas.“ He was born into a noble family, had extensive experience, and had a broad mind. The Renaissance period in which he lived was, on the one hand, breaking away from the chaos, conquest, barbarism and depression of the Dark Middle Ages; on the other hand, it was about to create a new era. This divisive turn made the spirit of this period full of liberating freedom, the courage to take risks, and the courage to try. From Bosch, Botticelli to Da Vinci, we can see the different styles of artistic innovation and the inheritance of difference. In terms of humanistic thought, Montaigne‘s The Essays also shows that people at this time were curious about everything, eager to express their opinions on everything, and full of various observations and insights, which also established the core meaning of the word “essay“ : An innovative attempt at thinking.
The Essays has a total of 107 short essays, covering daily life, custom analysis and life reflection, and is published in three volumes. This semester focuses on the discussion of “Volume 1“. The course is divided into two stages. The first stage is to understand Montaigne’s thoughts through text reading. The second stage explores the relationship between Montaigne’s thoughts and contemporary social phenomena, and the inspiration for shaping personal personality.
Week 01: Introduction.
Week 02: On sadness or pretense.
Week 03: On Passion.
Week 04: On boredom or emptying out.
Week 05: On lying or creation.
Week 06: On predictions or expectations.
Week 07: On hospitality.
Week 08: On friendship.
Week 09: On judgment or bias.
Week 10: On imagination or hallucination.
Week 11: On habits or mechanism.
Week 12: On difference or discrimination.
Week 13: Useless or useful.
Week 14: On luxury production or frugal sustainability.
Week 15: On Death and Philosophy.
Week 16: In terms of age.
Week 17: Final paper writing (independent research).
Week 18: Final paper writing (independent research).
